tit.j: コノハナノサクヤビメ
tit.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: コノハナノサクヤビメは、日本神話に登場する神。
sen.e: Konohana no sakuyabime is a goddess that appears in Japanese mythology.
Konohana no sakuyabime is a goddess that appears in Japanese mythology.
Konohana no sakuya-bime is a goddess that appears in Japanese mythology.

sen.j: 一般的には木花咲耶姫と記される。
sen.e: In general, her name is written as Konohana no sakuyabime.
In general, her name is written as Konohana no sakuyabime.
In general, her name is written as 木花咲耶姫.
sen.cmt: 木花咲耶姫 と漢字を追加しました。

sen.j: また『古事記』では木花之佐久夜毘売、『日本書紀』では木花開耶姫と表記する。
sen.e: Her name is written as Konohana no sakuyabime in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and as Konohana no sakuyabime in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
Her name is written as Konohana no sakuyabime in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and as Konohana no sakuyabime in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
Her name is written as 木花之佐久夜毘売 in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and as 木花開耶姫 in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: コノハナサクヤビメ、コノハナサクヤヒメ、又は単にサクヤビメと呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: She is also called Konohana sakuyabime, Konohana sakuyahime or simply as Sakuyahime.
She is also called Konohana sakuyabime, Konohana sakuyahime or simply as Sakuyahime.
She is also called Konohana sakuya-bime, Konohana sakuya-hime or simply as Sakuya-hime.
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: 『古事記』では神阿多都比売（カムアタツヒメ）、『日本書紀』では鹿葦津姫または葦津姫（カヤツヒメ）が本名で、コノハナノサクヤビメは別名としている。
sen.e: Her real name is Kamuatatsuhime in the "Kojiki" and Katsuyahime in "Nihonshoki," and Konohana no sakuyabime is used as an alternate name.
Her real name is Kamuatatsuhime in the "Kojiki" and Katsuyahime in "Nihonshoki," and Konohana no sakuyabime is used as an alternate name.
Her real name is Kamuatatsu-hime (神阿多都比売) in the "Kojiki" and Kayatsu-hime (鹿葦津姫 or 葦津姫) in "Nihonshoki," and Konohana no sakuya-bime is used as an alternate name.
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。漢字を追加しました。

sen.j: オオヤマツミの娘で、姉にイワナガヒメがいる。
sen.e: She was a daughter of Oyamatsumi, and Iwanagahime was her older sister.
She was a daughter of Oyamatsumi, and Iwanagahime was her older sister.
She was a daughter of Oyamatsumi, and Iwanaga-hime was her older sister.
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: ニニギの妻として、ホデリ（海幸彦）・ホスセリ・ホオリ（山幸彦）を生んだ。
sen.e: As Ninigi's wife she gave birth to Hoderi (Umisachihiko), Hosuseri and Hoori (Yamasachihiko).
As Ninigi's wife she gave birth to Hoderi (Umisachihiko), Hosuseri and Hoori (Yamasachihiko).
As Ninigi's wife she gave birth to Hoderi (Umisachihiko), Hosuseri and Hoori (Yamasachihiko).

sen.j: 神話の記述
sen.e: Description in the Mythology
Description in the Mythology
Description in the mythology
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 天孫降臨で日向国に降臨したニニギと笠沙の岬で出逢い求婚される。
sen.e: She met Ninigi, who had descended in the Province of Himuka upon Tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess) at Kasasa no misaki (Cape Kasasa), and he proposed her to marry him.

She met Ninigi, who had descended in the Province of Himuka upon Tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess) at Kasasa no misaki (Cape Kasasa), and he proposed her to marry him.

She met Ninigi, who had descended in the Province of Himuka upon Tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess) at Kasasa no misaki (Cape Kasasa), and he proposed her to marry him.

sen.j: 父のオオヤマツミはそれを喜んで、姉のイワナガヒメと共に差し出した。
sen.e: Her father, Oyamatsumi, was very happy about the news, and he offered him her older sister, Iwanagahime also.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Her father, Oyamatsumi, was very happy about the news, and he offered him her older sister, Iwanagahime also.
Her father, Oyamatsumi, was very happy about the news, and he offered him her older sister, Iwanaga-hime also.
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: しかし、ニニギは醜いイワナガヒメを送り返してコノハナノサクヤビメとだけ結婚した。
sen.e: Ninigi married only Konohana no sakuyabime and he sent home Iwanagahime, who was ugly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ninigi married only Konohana no sakuyabime and he sent home Iwanagahime, who was ugly.
However, Ninigi married only Konohana no sakuya-bime and he sent home Iwanaga-hime, who was ugly.
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: オオヤマツミは「私が娘二人を一緒に差し上げたのは、イワナガヒメを妻にすれば天津神の御子（ニニギ）の命は岩のように永遠のものとなり、コノハナノサクヤビメを妻にすれば木の花が咲くように繁栄するだろうと誓約を立てたからである。コノハナノサクヤビメだけと結婚したので、天津神の御子の命は木の花のようにはかなくなるだろう」と言った。
sen.e: Oyamatsumi said, 'I offered my two daughters together because I made a covenant that the son of Amatsukami (god of heaven) (Ninigi) will have a life as eternal as a rock if you have Iwanagahime as your wife, and if you have Konohana no sakuyabime as your wife then you will prosper just like flowers blossoming on a tree. However, because you married only Konohana no sakuyabime the life of the son of Amatsukami will be ephemeral like flowers on a tree.'

Oyamatsumi said, 'I offered my two daughters together because I made a covenant that the son of Amatsukami (god of heaven) (Ninigi) will have a life as eternal as a rock if you have Iwanagahime as your wife, and if you have Konohana no sakuyabime as your wife then you will prosper just like flowers blossoming on a tree. However, because you married only Konohana no sakuyabime the life of the son of Amatsukami will be ephemeral like flowers on a tree.'

Oyamatsumi said, 'I offered my two daughters together because I made a covenant that the son of Amatsukami (god of heaven) (Ninigi) will have a life as eternal as a rock if you have Iwanaga-hime as your wife, and if you have Konohana no sakuya-bime as your wife then you will prosper just like flowers blossoming on a tree. However, because you married only Konohana no sakuya-bime the life of the son of Amatsukami will be ephemeral like flowers on a tree.'
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: それでその子孫の天皇の寿命も神々ほどは長くないのである（天孫降臨コノハナノサクヤビメとイワナガヒメを参照）。
sen.e: That is why emperors, who are his descendants, do not live as long as the gods (refer to Tensonkorin Konohana no sakuyabime and Iwanagahime).
That is why emperors, who are his descendants, do not live as long as the gods (refer to Tensonkorin Konohana no sakuyabime and Iwanagahime).
That is why emperors, who are his descendants, do not live as long as the gods (refer to the section "Konohana no sakuya-bime and Iwanaga-hime" in "Tensonkorin").
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: コノハナノサクヤビメは一夜で身篭るが、ニニギは国津神の子ではないかと疑った。
sen.e: Konohana no sakuyabime became pregnant overnight, and Ninigi suspected that the child belonged to Kunitsukami (god of the land).
Konohana no sakuyabime became pregnant overnight, and Ninigi suspected that the child belonged to Kunitsukami (god of the land).
Konohana no sakuya-bime became pregnant overnight, and Ninigi suspected that the child belonged to Kunitsukami (god of the land).
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: 疑いを晴らすため、うけいをして産屋に入った。
sen.e: In order to disprove his suspicion she made a pledge and then went into the birthing room.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In order to disprove his suspicion she made a pledge and then went into the birthing room.
In order to disprove his suspicion she made a pledge and then went into the birthing room.

sen.j: 本当の子なら何があっても無事に産めるはずと、産屋に火を放った。
sen.e: She said that if her child was truly Ninigi's, then the child would be born safely no matter what, and she set fire on the birthing room.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She said that if her child was truly Ninigi's, then the child would be born safely no matter what, and she set fire on the birthing room.
She said that if her child was truly Ninigi's, then the child would be born safely no matter what, and she set fire on the birthing room.

sen.j: その中でホデリ・ホスセリ・ホオリの三柱の子を産んだ（天孫降臨コノハナノサクヤビメの出産を参照）。
sen.e: She gave birth to Mihashira no ko (three children), Hoderi, Hosuseri and Hoori, in the fire (refer to Tensonkorin Konohana no sakuyabime giving birth).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She gave birth to Mihashira no ko (three children), Hoderi, Hosuseri and Hoori, in the fire (refer to Tensonkorin Konohana no sakuyabime giving birth).
She gave birth to Mihashira no ko (three children), Hoderi, Hosuseri and Hoori, in the fire (refer to the section "Konohana no sakuya-bime giving birth" in "Tensonkorin").
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: ホオリの孫が神武天皇である。
sen.e: Emperor Jimmu was the grandson of Hoori.
Emperor Jimmu was the grandson of Hoori.
Emperor Jinmu was the grandson of Hoori.

sen.j: 解説
sen.e: Description
Description
Description

sen.j: コノハナノサクヤビメは木の花（サクラの花）が咲くように美しい女性の意味である。
sen.e: Konohana no sakuyabime means a woman as beautiful as flowers blossoming on a tree (cherry tree flowers).
Konohana no sakuyabime means a woman as beautiful as flowers blossoming on a tree (cherry tree flowers).
Konohana no sakuyabime means a woman as beautiful as flowers blossoming on a tree (cherry tree flowers).

sen.j: カムアタツヒメの「阿多」は薩摩国阿多郡阿多郷（現在の鹿児島県南さつま市周辺）のことであるとされている。
sen.e: It is considered that that 'ata' in Kamuatatsuhime comes from Ata-go, Ata-no-kori, Satsuma Province (the vicinity of present-day Minamisatsuma City, Kagoshima Prefecture).
It is considered that that 'ata' in Kamuatatsuhime comes from Ata-go, Ata-no-kori, Satsuma Province (the vicinity of present-day Minamisatsuma City, Kagoshima Prefecture).
It is considered that that 'ata' in Kamuatatsu-hime comes from Ata-go, Ata-no-kori, Satsuma Province (the vicinity of present-day Minamisatsuma City, Kagoshima Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: つまり阿多隼人の出身であり、その首領の娘という意味をもつ。
sen.e: That is, she was from Ata Hayato, and the name means the daughter of the chieftain of the area.
That is, she was from Ata Hayato, and the name means the daughter of the chieftain of the area.
That is, she was from Ata Hayato, and the name means the daughter of the chieftain of the area.

sen.j: コノハナノサクヤビメとカムアタツヒメは本来は別の神であったと考えられている。
sen.e: It is considered that Konohana no sakuyabime and Kamuatatsuhime were originally separate deities.
It is considered that Konohana no sakuyabime and Kamuatatsuhime were originally separate deities.
It is considered that Konohana no sakuya-bime and Kamuatatsu-hime were originally separate deities.
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: コノハナノサクヤビメとイワナガヒメの説話は短命・死の起源を語ったもので、東南アジアを中心に各地で見られるバナナ型神話の変形である。
sen.e: The story of Konohana no sakuyahime and Iwanagahime tells about the ephemerality of life and the origin of death, and this is one variation of banana-type mythology often seen in various areas around Southeast Asia.
sen.cmt: バナナ型神話は定訳不明
sen.e: The story of Konohana no sakuyahime and Iwanagahime tells about the ephemerality of life and the origin of death, and this is one variation of banana-type mythology often seen in various areas around Southeast Asia.

The story of Konohana no sakuya-bime and Iwanaga-hime tells about the ephemerality of life and the origin of death, and this is one variation of banana-type mythology often seen in various areas around Southeast Asia.
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: このバナナ型神話の説話を挿入する際に、オオヤマツミの子であるカムアタツヒメにその役割を負わせたものと考えられる。
sen.e: Upon inserting the story of this banana-type mythology, it can be considered that the task was given to Kamuatatsuhime, who was a daughter to Oyamatsumi.
sen.cmt: 原文意味不明、バナナ型神話は定訳不明
sen.e: Upon inserting the story of this banana-type mythology, it can be considered that the task was given to Kamuatatsuhime, who was a daughter to Oyamatsumi.

sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: 信仰
sen.e: Worship
Worship
Worship

sen.j: 火中出産の説話から火の神とされ、火山である富士山に祀られるようになった。
sen.e: Because she gave birth in fire she became a goddess fire, and she is enshrined at Mt. Fuji, which is a volcano.
Because she gave birth in fire she became a fire goddess, and she is enshrined at Mt. Fuji, which is a volcano.
Because she gave birth in fire she became a fire goddess, and she is enshrined at Mt. Fuji, which is a volcano.

sen.j: ただし、富士山本宮浅間大社の社伝では、コノハナノサクヤビメは水の神である。
sen.e: However, according to the legend passed down at Fujisan Hongu Sengen-taisha Shrine Konohana no sakuyabime is a goddess of water.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, according to the legend passed down at Fujisan Hongu Sengen-taisha Shrine Konohana no sakuyabime is a goddess of water.
However, according to the legend passed down at Fujisan Hongu Sengen-taisha Shrine Konohana no sakuya-bime is a goddess of water.
sen.cmt: 「姫」の表記を「-hime」として統一しました。

sen.j: 噴火を鎮めるために富士山に祀られたとしている。
sen.e: She was enshrined at Mt. Fuji in order to bring volcanic eruptions under control.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She was enshrined at Mt. Fuji in order to bring volcanic eruptions under control.
She was enshrined at Mt. Fuji in order to bring volcanic eruptions under control.

sen.j: また、この説話から妻の守護神、安産の神、子育ての神とされている。
sen.e: In addition, from this story, she is viewed as a goddess who protects one's wife, a goddess of safe delivery of a baby as well as a goddess of child rearing.
In addition, from this story, she is viewed as a goddess who protects one's wife, a goddess of safe delivery of a baby as well as a goddess of child rearing.
In addition, from this story, she is viewed as a goddess who protects one's wife, a goddess of safe delivery of a baby as well as a goddess of child rearing.

sen.j: さらに、ホオリらが産まれた時にオオヤマツミが狭名田の茂穂をもって、今日の甘酒とされる天舐酒（アマノタムケザケ）を造ったとの説話がある。
sen.e: Furthermore, there is a story of Oyamatsumi making amano tamukezake, which is present-day amazake (sweet, mild sake), using the heavily fruited head of rice plant from Sanada when Hoori was born.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, there is a story of Oyamatsumi making amano tamukezake, which is present-day amazake (sweet, mild sake), using the heavily fruited head of rice plant from Sanada when Hoori was born.
Furthermore, there is a story of Oyamatsumi making amano tamukezake, which is present-day amazake (sweet, mild sake), using the heavily fruited head of rice plant from Sanada when Hoori was born.

sen.j: したがって、オオヤマツミはサカトケノカミ（酒解神）、コノハナノサクヤビメはサカトケコノカミ（酒解子神）と呼ばれて、酒造の神ともされる。
sen.e: Therefore, Oyamatsumi is called Sakatokenokami and Konohana no sakuyabime is called Sakatokekonokami, and they are considered to be deities of sake brewing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, Oyamatsumi is called Sakatokenokami and Konohana no sakuyabime is called Sakatokekonokami, and they are considered to be deities of sake brewing.
Therefore, Oyamatsumi is called Sakatoke no Kami and Konohana no sakuya-bime is called Sakatokeko no Kami, and they are considered to be deities of sake brewing.
sen.cmt: 神名表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 父のオオヤマツミは各地の山を統括する神である。
sen.e: Her father, Oyamatsumi, is a god that represented all the mountains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Her father, Oyamatsumi, is a god that represented all the mountains.
Her father, Oyamatsumi, is a god that represented all the mountains.

sen.j: その父から日本一の秀峰富士山を譲られた。
sen.e: She inherited Mt. Fuji from her father, the tallest and the most beautiful mountain in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She inherited Mt. Fuji from her father, the tallest and the most beautiful mountain in Japan.
She inherited Mt. Fuji from her father, the tallest and the most beautiful mountain in Japan.

sen.j: この山に鎮座して東日本一帯を守護することになった。
sen.e: She is enshrined in this mountain and protects the eastern part of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She is enshrined in this mountain and protects the eastern part of Japan.
She is enshrined in this mountain and protects the eastern part of Japan.

sen.j: 富士山の祭神として富士山本宮浅間大社（静岡県富士宮市）のほか、全国の浅間神社に祀られている。
sen.e: In addition to being the enshrined deity of Mt. Fuji at Fujisan Hongu Sengen-taisha Shrine (Fujinomiya City, Shizuoka Prefecture), she is also enshrined at Sengen-jinja Shrines all over Japan.
In addition to being the enshrined deity of Mt. Fuji at Fujisan Hongu Sengen-taisha Shrine (Fujinomiya City, Shizuoka Prefecture), she is also enshrined at Sengen-jinja Shrines all over Japan.

sen.j: また、安産や子育ての神として子安神社（皇大神宮所管社、東京都八王子市など）に祀られている。
sen.e: In addition, she is enshrined as a goddess of safe delivery and child rearing at Koyasu-jinja Shrine (Shokansha (shrine where the gods of clothing, food and housing are worshipped) at Kotai-jingu Shrine in Hachioji City, Tokyo, for example).

sen.j: また、酒解子神として梅宮大社（京都府右京区）にも祀られている。
sen.e: She is also enshrined as Sakatokekonokami at Umenomiya-taisha Shrine (Unkyo Ward, Kyoto Prefecture).
